IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO CARE FOR AND TRANSPORT THE CRITICALLY ILL AND INJURED. MEDFLIGHT OPERATES 8 MEDICAL HELICOPTERS AND 3 MOBILE INTENSIVE CARE UNITS (MICU'S).
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO CARE FOR AND TRANSPORT THE CRITICALLY ILL AND INJURED.
IRS990.Description: DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED 6/30/10, MEDFLIGHT TRANSPORTED 3,450 CRITICALLY ILL & INJURED PATIENTS BY HELICOPTER FROM ACCIDENT SCENES TO LEVEL 1 & 2 TRAUMA CENTERS OR FROM SMALLER COMMUNITY HOSPITALS TO LARGE TERTIARY CARE CENTERS TO RECEIVE SPECIALIZED CARE. AN ADDITIONAL 2,094 PATIENTS WERE TRANSPORTED BY MOBILE INTENSIVE CARE UNITS (MICU'S) FROM ACCIDENT SCENES TO LEVEL 1 & 2 TRAUMA CENTERS OR FROM SMALLER COMMUNITY HOSPITALS TO LARGE TERTIARY CARE CENTERS TO RECEIVE SPECIALIZED CARE. INCLUDED IN THESE EXPENSES ARE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH PROVIDING CARE TO PATIENTS WHO MEET CERTAIN CRITERIA UNDER MEDFLIGHT'S CHARITY CARE POLICY WITHOUT CHARGE OR AT AMOUNTS LESS THAN ITS ESTABLISHED RATES. BECAUSE MEDFLIGHT DOES NOT PURSUE COLLECTION OF AMOUNTS DETERMINED TO QUALIFY AS CHARITY CARE, THEY ARE NOT REPORTED AS REVENUE. THE AMOUNT OF CHARGES FOREGONE FOR SERVICES AND SUPPLIES FURNISHED UNDER MEDFLIGHT'S CHARITY CARE POLICY AGGREGATED APPROXIMATELY 4,400,000 IN 2010.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: ROD CRANE - $102,478; CHARLES ANSLEY - $17,267; TOM ALLENSTEIN - $4,751

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IN APRIL 2010, MEDFLIGHT BECAME A 60% MEMBER OF MEDCARE AMBULANCE, INC. MEDCARE IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION THAT OPERATES EMERGENCY AND NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL VAN AND LICENSED AMBULANCES TO SERVE CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF OHIO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS TWO CLASS A MEMBERS WHO EACH APPOINT TWO BOARD MEMBERS AS WELL AS ONE CLASS B MEMBER WHO APPOINTS ONE BOARD MEMBER FOR A TOTAL OF FIVE BOARD MEMBERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CEOS OF THE TWO CLASS A MEMBERS APPROVE CERTAIN DECISIONS OF MEDFLIGHT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE ARE NO COMMITTEES WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL SERVICES AND THE CFO REVIEW THE 990, AND COPIES ARE EMAILED TO THE BOARD, BEFORE THE CFO AUTHORIZES THE AUDITOR TO FILE ELECTRONICALLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DURING THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE PROCESS THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL SERVICES REVIEWS THE CHECK REGISTER FOR ANY DISTRIBUTIONS TO DISQUALIFIED PERSONS. THESE DISTRIBUTIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE CFO. THERE HAVE BEEN NO TRANSACTIONS WITH DISQUALIFIED PERSONS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRMS PERFORM ANNUAL WAGE SURVEYS FOR NON-EXECUTIVES AND SALARY SURVEYS EVERY TWO TO FOUR YEARS FOR EXECUTIVES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE ENTIRE BOARD OVERSEES THE AUDIT.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: THE CENTER FOR MEDICAL TRANSPORT RESEARCH LLC
